taxon_identification.name_authority_date: Panicum dichotomiflorum subsp. bartowense (Scribn. & Merr.) Freckmann & Lelong

bio:treatment.description: Culms often 100-200 cm, stout, erect, simple or sparingly branched. Sheaths loosely overlapping, prominently hispid, hairs papillose-based. Pedicels usually less than 3 mm and shorter than the spikelets. Spikelets 2.3-2.8 mm, tapered from below the middle to the acuminate apices; upper glumes and lower lemmas subcoriaceous.
bio:treatment.discussion: Panicum dichotomiflorum subsp. bartowense grows in Florida, Cuba, and the Bahamas. Reports from more northerly areas may represent introductions or misidentifications.
